thread.title: Top 45 Astonishing Photos of the Naples Botanical Garden
thread.title_full: Top 45 Astonishing Photos of the Naples Botanical Garden

author: Ronald Robbins
title: Top 45 Astonishing Photos of the Naples Botanical Garden
text: By Ronald Robbins | October 16, 2015 - 4:51 pm | North America , Travel Blog 1 Flares 1 Flares × With over 170 acres of astonishing lands, Naples Botanical Garden along the Paradise Coast of Florida has proven to conserve, engage, and inspire visitors from all over the world. After having some pretty great adventures just north of Naples kayaking Juniper Springs State Park , followed up with jet skiing through mangrove trees , I decided to take it easy and see what the local plant enthusiast had put together. Cleary this was the perfect opportunity to see an example of the culture and flora of the tropics and it was unlike any other botanical garden I’ve been to in the United States. But, without further ado, I present to you the Top 45 most astonishing photos I just managed to capture at the Naples Botanical Garden! The Best of the Naples Botanical Garden As you can see, the Naples Botanical Garden has a plethora of breathtaking plantlike all over their property. Although similar in ways to that of the Denver Botanical Garden , the Garden Isle of Hawaii , or even the naturally grown flowers around Arenal Volcano in Costa Rica , it is still worth a visit especially if you’re visiting the area on a budget. What the most breathtaking garden you’ve ever been to? You May Also Like:
